midas/drivers/bus/camacrpc.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Name:         camacrpc.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     CAMAC RPC driver, works together with CAMAC RPC server,
00007                 either as dedicated server (camacsrv.c) or inside a
00008                 CAMAC frontend (mfe.c)
00009 
00010   $Log: camacrpc.c,v $
00011   Revision 1.2  2005/06/20 23:46:25  mucap
00012   (Fred)
00013   The following construct (which appears repeatedly in this file):
00014               ((char *) (*d)) += size;
00015   is not accepted by gcc 4.0 (the standard compiler in Fedora Core 4), so I
00016   rewrote it as:
00017               *d = (DWORD *) ((char *) (*d) + size);
00018 
00019   Revision 1.6  2004/01/08 08:40:08  midas
00020   Implemented standard indentation
00021 
00022   Revision 1.5  2003/04/23 20:57:52  pierre
00023   add client_name arg to rpc_client_connect
00024 
00025   Revision 1.4  2002/05/08 19:54:40  midas
00026   Added extra parameter to function db_get_value()
00027 
00028   Revision 1.3  2001/08/28 08:43:46  midas
00029   Changed dummy interrupt function parameters
00030 
00031   Revision 1.2  2000/08/10 07:48:29  midas
00032   Added client name together with frontend name in cam_init_rpc
00033 
00034   Revision 1.1  1999/12/20 10:18:55  midas
00035   Added files
00036 
00037   Revision 1.7  1999/05/06 18:49:54  pierre
00038   - Fix return code using midas code.
00039 
00040   Revision 1.6  1999/02/22 19:04:50  pierre
00041   - Remove came_xxx
00042 
00043   Revision 1.5  1998/11/22 18:27:58  midas
00044   Fixed &x and &q pointer bugs in various functions
00045 
00046   Revision 1.4  1998/10/13 07:23:21  midas
00047   Added void to cam_interrupt_attach(void (*isr)(void))
00048 
00049   Revision 1.3  1998/10/12 09:34:08  midas
00050   -SR- added back CNAF_TEST instead of CNAF. This way, no CAMAC cycle is executed
00051        during the test.
00052 
00053   Revision 1.2  1998/10/09 22:56:49  midas
00054   -PAA- int to DWORD *lam
00055 
00056   Revision 1.0  1998/4/17
00057   -SR- created
00058 
00059 \********************************************************************/

00061 #include <stdio.h>
00062 #include "midas.h"
00063 #include "msystem.h"
00064 #include "mcstd.h"
00065 
00066 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00067 
00068 HNDLE hConn = 0;
00069 BOOL midas_connect;
00070 
00071 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00072 
00073 int cam_init_rpc(char *host_name, char *exp_name, char *fe_name,
00074                  char *client_name, char *rpc_server)
00075 {
00076    INT status, i, size;
00077    char str[256];
00078    HNDLE hDB, hKey, hRootKey, hSubkey;
00079 
00080    if (rpc_server[0]) {
00081       /* connect directly to RPC server, not to MIDAS experiment */
00082       midas_connect = FALSE;
00083 
00084 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00085       {
00086          WSADATA WSAData;
00087 
00088          /* Start windows sockets */
00089          if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
00090             return RPC_NET_ERROR;
00091       }
00092 #endif
00093 
00094       rpc_set_name(client_name);
00095       rpc_register_functions(rpc_get_internal_list(0), NULL);
00096       rpc_register_functions(rpc_get_internal_list(1), NULL);
00097 
00098       status = rpc_client_connect(rpc_server, 1750, client_name, &hConn);
00099       if (status != RPC_SUCCESS) {
00100          printf("Cannot connect to RPC server running on %s at port 1750.\n", rpc_server);
00101          return status;
00102       }
00103    } else {
00104       /* connect to MIDAS experiment */
00105       midas_connect = TRUE;
00106 
00107       /* turn off message display, turn on message logging */
00108       cm_set_msg_print(MT_ALL, 0, NULL);
00109 
00110       /* connect to experiment */
00111       status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, exp_name, client_name, 0);
00112       if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
00113          return CM_UNDEF_EXP;
00114 
00115       /* connect to the database */
00116       cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
00117 
00118       /* find CNAF server if not specified */
00119       strcpy(str, fe_name);
00120       if (fe_name[0] == '\0') {
00121          /* find client which exports CNAF function */
00122          status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hRootKey);
00123          if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
00124             for (i = 0, status = 0;; i++) {
00125                status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hSubkey);
00126                if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS) {
00127                   printf("No client currently exports the CNAF functionality.\n");
00128                   cm_disconnect_experiment();
00129                   return CM_UNDEF_EXP;
00130                }
00131 
00132                sprintf(str, "RPC/%d", RPC_CNAF16);
00133                status = db_find_key(hDB, hSubkey, str, &hKey);
00134                if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
00135                   size = sizeof(str);
00136                   db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
00137                   break;
00138                }
00139             }
00140          }
00141       }
00142 
00143       /* register CNAF_RPC call */
00144       if (cm_connect_client(str, &hConn) == CM_SUCCESS) {
00145          DWORD data, size, q, x;
00146 
00147          /* test if CNAF function implemented */
00148          size = sizeof(WORD);
00149          status =
00150              rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_CNAF16, CNAF_TEST, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, &data, &size,
00151                              &q, &x);
00152 
00153          if (status != RPC_SUCCESS) {
00154             printf("CNAF functionality not implemented by frontend %s\n", fe_name);
00155             cm_disconnect_client(hConn, FALSE);
00156             return CM_NO_CLIENT;
00157          }
00158       } else {
00159          printf("Cannot connect to frontend %s\n", fe_name);
00160          return CM_NO_CLIENT;
00161       }
00162    }
00163 
00164    return SUCCESS;
00165 }
00166 
00167 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00168 
00169 void cami(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, WORD * d)
00170 {
00171    INT status, size, x, q;
00172 
00173    size = sizeof(WORD);
00174    status = rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_CNAF16, CNAF, 0, c, n, a, f, d, &size, &x, &q);
00175    if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
00176       printf("RPC error %d\n", status);
00177 }

00184 }

00224 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00225 
00226 void cam16i_r(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, WORD ** d, const int r)
00227 {
00228    INT status, size, x, q;
00229 
00230    size = sizeof(WORD) * r;
00231 
00232    status = rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_CNAF16, CNAF, 0, c, n, a, f, *d, &size, &x, &q);
00233 
00234    if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
00235       printf("RPC error %d\n", status);
00236    else
00237       *d = (WORD *) ((char *) (*d) + size);
00238 }

00286 
00287 void cam16i_sa(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f, WORD ** d, const int r)
00288 {
00289    INT status, size, i, x, q;
00290 
00291    for (i = 0; i < r; i++) {
00292       size = sizeof(WORD);
00293       status =
00294           rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_CNAF16, CNAF, 0, c, n, a + i, f, *d, &size, &x, &q);
00295 
00296       if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
00297          printf("RPC error %d\n", status);
00298       else
00299          *d = (WORD *) ((char *) (*d) + size);
00300    }
00301 }

00445 void camc(const int c, const int n, const int a, const int f)
00446 {
00447    INT status, size, x, q;
00448 
00449    size = sizeof(WORD);
00450    status = 0;
00451    status =
00452        rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_CNAF16, CNAF, 0, c, n, a, f, &status, &size, &x, &q);
00453    if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
00454       printf("RPC error %d\n", status);
00455 }

00493 int cam_init(void)
00494 {
00495    return 1;
00496 }
00497 
00498 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00499 
00500 void cam_exit(void)
00501 {
00502    if (midas_connect) {
00503       cm_disconnect_client(hConn, FALSE);
00504       cm_disconnect_experiment();
00505    } else {
00506       if (hConn)
00507          rpc_client_disconnect(hConn, FALSE);
00508    }
00509 }
00510 
00511 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00512 
00513 void cam_inhibit_set(const int c)
00514 {
00515    INT status, size, dummy;
00516 
00517    dummy = 0;
00518    size = sizeof(INT);
00519    status = rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_CNAF16, CNAF_INHIBIT_SET, 0, c, 0, 0, 0,
00520                             &dummy, &size, &dummy, &dummy);
00521    if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
00522       printf("RPC error %d\n", status);
00523 }
00524 
00525 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00526 
00527 void cam_inhibit_clear(const int c)
00528 {
00529    INT status, size, dummy;
00530 
00531    dummy = 0;
00532    size = sizeof(INT);
00533    status = rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_CNAF16, CNAF_INHIBIT_CLEAR, 0, c, 0, 0, 0,
00534                             &dummy, &size, &dummy, &dummy);
00535    if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
00536       printf("RPC error %d\n", status);
00537 }

00555 void cam_crate_zinit(const int c)
00556 {
00557    INT status, size, dummy;
00558 
00559    dummy = 0;
00560    size = sizeof(INT);
00561    status = rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_CNAF16, CNAF_CRATE_ZINIT, 0, c, 0, 0, 0,
00562                             &dummy, &size, &dummy, &dummy);
00563    if (status != RPC_SUCCESS)
00564       printf("RPC error %d\n", status);

00567 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00568 
00569 void cam_lam_enable(const int c, const int n)
00570 {
00571    /* enable LAM flip-flop in unit */
00572    camc(c, n, 0, 26);
00573 
00574    /* clear LAM flip-flop in unit */
00575    camc(c, n, 0, 10);
00576 }
00577 
00578 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00579 
00580 void cam_lam_disable(const int c, const int n)
00581 {
00582    /* enable LAM flip-flop in unit */
00583    camc(c, n, 0, 24);
00584 }
00585

00590 }
00591 void cam_lam_clear(const int c, const int n)
00592 {
00593    /* clear LAM flip-flop in unit */
00594    camc(c, n, 0, 10);
00595 }
